titleStmt.title: A study of temperature dependent local atomic displacements in a Ba(Fe<sub>1−x</sub>Co<sub>x</sub>)<sub>2</sub>As<sub>2</sub>superconductor

analytic.title: A study of temperature dependent local atomic displacements in a Ba(Fe<sub>1−x</sub>Co<sub>x</sub>)<sub>2</sub>As<sub>2</sub>superconductor

div.head: Report:
div.p: During this beamtime, we have studied the local structure of a Ba(Fe 1-x Co x ) 2 As 2 superconductor using temperature dependent extended x-ray absorption fine structure (EXAFS) measurements. Polarized EXAFS at the Fe K-edge on an optimally doped (x = 0.06) single crystal has permitted us to determine atomic displacements across the superconducting transition temperature (T c ). The Fe-As bondlength is found to have hardly any change with temperature; however, the Fe-Fe bonds revealed a significant drop in mean square relative displacements across T c . We have also found a large atomic disorder around the substituted Co,
